item.title: Report E-2025030087
item.description:
Report E-2025030087

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 5, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of gasoline was damaged by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the released gasoline. All impacted material and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025030046
item.description:
Report E-2025030046

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-16
  • City: TOOMSBORO
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FLORIDA ROCK & TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 295000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: This was a single vehicle accident in which our driver gradually left the roadway onto the slopped shoulder area. the driver attempted to return the vehicle onto the roadway, this initiated the rollover sequence. The trailer came to rest upside down which allowed the product to spill from multiple dome lids. The driver sustained life threatening injuries and was transported to the hospital where he was pronounced deceased. It us unknown why the driver left the roadway. This was reported to the National Response Center #1423708
